intro: Vincetoxicum obliquum, commonly known as false bindweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in summer, followed by orange-red berries. Its roots contain toxic alkaloids, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Vincetoxicum obliquum is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
